page.title: List of Big Brother (Australian TV series) season 7 housemates

revision.text:
{{Use Australian English|date=May 2015}} {{DISPLAYTITLE:List of ''Big Brother'' (Australian TV series) season 7 housemates}} The following is a '''list of housemates''' who were contestants on 2007's [[Big Brother (Australian TV series)|Australian]] ''[[Big Brother 7 (Australia)|Big Brother]]'':
== Housemates == [[File:Bb2007cast.jpg|276px|thumb|The starting ''Big Brother Australia'' 2007 housemates. ''From left to right, back row to front row:'' Jamie, Kate, Aleisha, Thomas, Hayley, Rebecca, Joel, Emma, Bodie, TJ, Andrew and Travis, on the announcement that the prize money for the 2007 series stood at zero.]] During the first week of the season, 15 housemates were added to the house. 12 went into the house on opening night while viewers could vote in two extra housemates, one male and one female from a group of six. The following night, Susannah and Zoran entered the house along with an extra housemate, Billy who is added to put Hayley and Andrew's secret relationship challenge into jeopardy. On Day 11, Demet entered the house after being voted in by the existing housemates. Nick entered the house on Day 18 as the winner of the Starburst Golden Key promotion. A further two female housemates, Daniela and Laura, later entered as ''[[Big Brother Australia#Intruders|Intruders]]'' on Day 31. Two further Intruders Michelle and Zach, entered on Day 50. On Day 84, a Celebrity guest known officially as a Housemate: Kyle Sandilands entered the house with a mission from Big Brother. The total number of housemates to enter the house is 24.
=== Aleisha === '''Aleisha Cowcher'''<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.bordermail.com.au/news/bm/local/752293.html | title = Aleisha has towns glued to Big Brother house | last = Dean | first = Sarah | date = 24 April 2007 | publisher = [[The Border Mail]] | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20070928030610/http://www.bordermail.com.au/news/bm/local/752293.html | archive-date = 28 September 2007 | dead-url=yes | accessdate=25 April 2007 }}</ref> (born 22 May 1986) is a hairdresser from [[Cobram, Victoria|Cobram]], Victoria and grew up in the country with seven other siblings. The popular housemate describes herself as hyperactive, energetic and modest. She claims that she often day-dreams about men.<ref name="Aleisha">{{cite web | url = http://www.bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/housemate-bio.html?id=3 | title = Aleisha's Biography | publisher = Ten official site | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20070831142035/http://bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/housemate-bio.html?id=3 | archive-date = 31 August 2007 | dead-url = yes }}</ref> Aleisha celebrated her 21st birthday in the house on 22 May 2007, and requested a "country" theme. She is the longest sustaining original housemate of the season yet to be nominated until Big Brother nominated her after the housemates failed the Police Academy weekly task in Week 9. Aleisha is announced finalist against Zach on Sunday 29 July 2007. On Monday 30 July 2007, she is announced winner of Big Brother 2007, in the closest voting result in a finale yet, with 51% of the vote.<ref name="Aleisha wins">{{cite news | url = http://www.news.com.au/adelaidenow/story/0,22606,22162502-5006301,00.html | title = Oh Brother, what a yawn | last = Devlin | first = Rebekah | date=31 July 2007 | accessdate = 17 May 2018 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20090220152449/http://www.news.com.au/adelaidenow/story/0,22606,22162502-5006301,00.html | archive-date = 20 February 2009 | dead-url=yes | publisher=[[The Advertiser (Australia)|The Advertiser]] }}</ref> She is the second female housemate to have won the Australian series. She has since moved to [[Sydney]] with former housemate Emma and appeared in Australian men's magazine [[Zoo Weekly#Australian edition|Zoo Weekly]]. She later moved to Melbourne with Billy and owns a hairdressing business "Telleleish" with her sister. She is no longer with Billy and has since married with one daughter Brighton in 2013.
{{s-start}} {{succession box|title=''[[Big Brother Australia|Big Brother Australia]]'' winner|before=[[Jamie Brooksby]]|after=[[List of Big Brother Australia housemates (2008 series)#Terri|Terri Munro]]|years=[[Big Brother 7 (Australia)|Series 7 (2007)]]}} {{s-end}}
=== Andrew === '''Andrew Temmet'''<ref name="Andrew Temmet">{{cite news | url= http://www.news.com.au/heraldsun/story/0,21985,21783343-28957,00.html | title = Death to be kept secret | author=<!-- No by-line --> | date = 24 May 2007 | accessdate = 6 June 2007 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20070704181042/http://www.news.com.au/heraldsun/story/0,21985,21783343-28957,00.html | archive-date = 4 July 2007 | dead-url = yes | publisher=[[Herald Sun]] }}</ref> is an [[Metropolitan Fire Brigade (Melbourne)|MFB]] Firefighter from [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]]. Andrew cannot stand messy, lazy and irresponsible people. He describes himself as happy, confident and tidy.<ref name="Andrew">{{cite web | url = http://www.bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/housemate-bio.html?id=4 | title = Andrew's Biography | publisher = Ten official site | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20070831143210/http://www.bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/housemate-bio.html?id=4 | archive-date = 31 August 2007 | dead-url = yes }}</ref> He is in a relationship with [[#Hayley|Hayley]] which is being kept secret from the other housemates as a week one challenge set by Big Brother. Andrew is involved in a heated argument with Bodie stemming from Bodie's claims that Hayley is "playing the game". He currently holds the title of the best ever housemate in the Friday Night Games, with three victories to his credit, and also runner-up once. Andrew claimed in Week 9 that his Big Brother contract only lasted until early July, while all other housemates' contracts last until mid-August, since Andrew could only take leave from his job for two months, and that if he is not evicted he would be willing to walk out.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.behindbigbrother.com/posts/updates/1396 | title = Andrew Leaving Either Way | date=23 June 2007 | publisher = Behind Big Brother Australia | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20070626042704/http://www.behindbigbrother.com/posts/updates/1396 | archive-date= 26 June 2007 | dead-url=yes | accessdate=23 June 2007 }}</ref> He is the eleventh housemate to be evicted, on Day 64, by public voting with 24% of the merged vote, along with Thomas in a double eviction. After Big Brother 2007, Hayley and Andrew have ended their relationship.
=== Billy === '''Kris William "Billy" Bentley'''<ref name="Kris Zach">{{cite news | url = http://www.news.com.au/couriermail/story/0,23739,22156853-7642,00.html | title = Travis tells of secret pain | last = Harris | first = Amy | date = 30 July 2007 | accessdate = 30 July 2007 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20090220161659/http://www.news.com.au/couriermail/story/0,23739,22156853-7642,00.html | archive-date = 20 February 2009 | dead-url = yes | publisher=[[The Courier-Mail]] }}</ref> (born 1983) (also known in publicity as '''Mr. X''' prior to entering the house) is a former boyfriend of housemate [[#Hayley|Hayley]]. He is brought into the house to stir up the hidden relationship of Andrew and Hayley.<ref>{{cite news | url = http://www.news.com.au/entertainment/story/0,23663,21610283-10388,00.html | title = Billy the Big Brother bombshell | date=24 April 2007 | accessdate = 25 April 2007 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20110604144657/http://www.news.com.au/billy-the-big-brother-bombshell/story-e6frfmq9-1111113399159 | archive-date = 4 June 2011 | dead-url =yes | publisher = [[The Daily Telegraph (Sydney)|The Daily Telegraph]] }}</ref> Billy states his occupation as being an insurance broker. He was travelling in [[Canada]] when approached by Big Brother producers to enter the house. Billy was not originally a legitimate housemate however was granted this position on Day 16 for the success of his task in challenging Andrew and Hayley's secret couple task. On Day 99, Billy was evicted with 14% of the merged vote, finishing in fourth place. In 2015, Bentley began co-hosting Channel 11's [[Couch Time]].
=== Bodie === '''Bodie Czeladka'''<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.scenemodels.com/models/1024/Bodie+Czeladka | title=Bodie Czeladka | year = 2007 | publisher = Scene Models | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20070509024019/http://www.scenemodels.com/models/1024/Bodie+Czeladka | archive-date = 9 May 2007 | dead-url = yes | accessdate = 29 April 2007 }}</ref> (born 1983) was an electrical designer from [[Western Australia]] and is of [[Poland|Polish]]-[[Croatia]]n heritage. He is an underwear model and describes himself as grateful, abundant woman wants and is a ladies' man.{{Citation needed|date=April 2016}} He described himself as an "undiagnosed [[ADHD]] sufferer".<ref name="BB picks OCD contestant">{{cite news | url = http://www.news.com.au/entertainment/story/0,23663,21540405-10229,00.html | title = BB picks OCD contestant | last = Casey | first = Marcus | date= 12 April 2007 | accessdate = 25 April 2007 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20070519214813/http://www.news.com.au/entertainment/story/0,23663,21540405-10229,00.html | archive-date = 19 May 2007 | dead-url = yes | publisher=[[The Daily Telegraph (Sydney)|The Daily Telegraph]] }}</ref> In an unprecedented step, he is designated by Big Brother as a ''"non-housemate"'' because he broke rules about discussing nominations. He is not permitted to make contact with the rest of the housemates and is to be separated from them at all times. He is reinstated by Big Brother as a ''"housemate"'' before the end of Day 10. He is the third housemate to be evicted on Day 22 by public voting with 7% of the merged vote, along with on-again off-again girlfriend TJ, in a double eviction. He was given a stern talking to by executive producer Kris Noble and host [[Gretel Killeen]] after throwing a rubber chicken prop at her head whilst on air during the finale.<ref>{{cite news | url = http://www.news.com.au/entertainment/story/0,23663,22167587-10229,00.html | title = Big Brother in a fowl throw | author = Sydney Confidential | date = 1 August 2007 | accessdate = 1 August 2007 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20090221103105/http://www.news.com.au/entertainment/story/0%2C23663%2C22167587-10229%2C00.html | archive-date = 21 February 2009 | dead-url = yes | publisher=[[The Daily Telegraph (Sydney)|The Daily Telegraph]] }}</ref> Bodie was dating ex-housemate and ''Friday Night Live'' host [[Bree Amer]].<ref>{{cite news | url = http://www.news.com.au/dailytelegraph/story/0,22049,22374303-5006002,00.html | title = Bodie's got a taste for Bree pants | date = 7 September 2007 | accessdate = 3 November 2007 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071104085213/http://www.news.com.au/dailytelegraph/story/0,22049,22374303-5006002,00.html | archive-date = 4 November 2007 | dead-url = yes | publisher=[[The Daily Telegraph (Sydney)|The Daily Telegraph]] }}</ref>
=== Daniela === '''Daniela Da Silva Pola'''<ref name="Daniela Media">{{cite web | url = http://www.who.com/who/interviews/article/0,19971,1643688,00.html | title = Daniela Skips Out of the Big Brother House | last = Bishop | first = Olivia | date = 16 July 2007 | publisher = [[Who (magazine)|Who Weekly]] | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20070716105629/http://www.who.com/who/interviews/article/0,19971,1643688,00.html | archive-date = 16 July 2007 | dead-url=yes | accessdate=16 July 2007 }}</ref> (born 1982) was a journalism student<ref name="Daniela Media" /> from [[Western Australia]]. She is an Intruder who entered the house on Day 31 on a special [[Big Brother Australia 2007#Intruder Alert!|Intruder Alert!]] show.<ref name="Daniela">{{cite web | url=http://bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/news/Lil-Sis-Meet-the-Intruders-171.html | title=Lil' Sis: Meet the Intruders! | publisher=Ten official site | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070523075227/http://bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/news/Lil-Sis-Meet-the-Intruders-171.html | archive-date=23 May 2007 | dead-url=yes }}</ref> Daniela was born in [[Brazil]] and moved to Australia in her childhood. She describes herself as charismatic, sincere and emotional.<ref name="Daniela bio">{{cite web | url = http://bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/housemate-bio.html?id=22 | title = Daniela's Biography | publisher = Ten official site | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20070927220802/http://bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/housemate-bio.html?id=22 | archive-date = 27 September 2007 | dead-url = yes }}</ref> She was evicted by her fellow housemates on Day 85, and was the fifteenth evictee.
=== Demet === '''Demet Sahan'''<ref name="Demet">{{cite news | url = http://www.news.com.au/heraldsun/story/0,21985,21770418-28957,00.html | title = Muslim comment annoys Demet | author=<!-- no by-line --> | date=22 May 2007 | accessdate=22 May 2007 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090220135408/http://www.news.com.au/heraldsun/story/0,21985,21770418-28957,00.html | archive-date=20 February 2009 | dead-url=yes | publisher=[[Herald Sun]] }}</ref> (born 1981) is a belly dancer from [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]] with a [[Turkey|Turkish]] background. She turned 26 during her time in the White Room. On Day 11, Demet entered the house officially after she was voted in by the Big Brother housemates. Demet was seen as being hypocritical for lying during a heated argument involving her, Hayley, Andrew, Emma, Nick, Zoran and (briefly) Susannah on Day 22.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/news/Demet-vs-The-Couple-147.html | title = Demet vs The Couple | publisher = Ten official site | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20070516040000/http://bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/news/Demet-vs-The-Couple-147.html | archive-date = 16 May 2007 | dead-url = yes}}</ref> She is the fourth housemate to be evicted by public voting, on Day 29, with 65% of the merged vote.
=== Emma === '''Emma Cornell'''<ref name="Emma Media">{{cite news | url = http://www.news.com.au/dailytelegraph/story/0,22049,21612815-5001021,00.html | title = Emma does a Krystal | author=<!-- no by-line --> | date = 24 April 2007 | accessdate = 25 April 2007 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20070701033802/http://www.news.com.au/sundaytelegraph/story/0,,21612815-5001021,00.html | archive-date = 1 July 2007 | dead-url = yes | publisher=[[The Daily Telegraph (Sydney)|The Daily Telegraph]] }}</ref> (born 1983) is a personal trainer from [[South Australia]]. Emma is the second eldest of seven children, and describes herself as the black sheep of her family. Emma also describes herself as daring, stubborn and vivacious.<ref name="Emma">{{cite web | url = http://www.bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/housemate-bio.html?id=5 | title = Emma's Biography | publisher = Ten official site | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20070425205204/http://www.bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/housemate-bio.html?id=5 | archive-date = 25 April 2007 | dead-url = yes }}</ref> Emma is a former Adelaide-based model and was winner of the South Australian section of the Ralph Swimsuit Model of the Year competition in 2005.<ref name="EmmaRalph">{{cite web | url = http://ralph.ninemsn.com.au/article.aspx?id=45814 | title = Swimwear model of the year – 2005 finalists | publisher = [[Ralph (magazine)|Ralph magazine]] | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20050316214912/http://ralph.ninemsn.com.au/article.aspx?id=45814 | archive-date = 16 March 2005 | dead-url = yes }}</ref> Emma underwent [[Breast implant|breast enlargement]] surgery more than six months before entering the Big Brother House to enhance her modelling career.<ref name="Emma Media" /> She was the subject of a nude pictorial for [[Zoo Weekly#Australian edition|Zoo Weekly]], photographed before she entered the Big Brother House, in the 14 May edition.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.zooweekly.com.au/members/viewPost.php?pid=0&aid=1674 | title = Babe of the Day: Emma Cornell | publisher = [[Zoo Weekly#Australian edition|Zoo Weekly]] | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20070509011110/http://www.zooweekly.com.au/members/viewPost.php?pid=0&aid=1674 | archive-date = 9 May 2007 | dead-url = yes }}</ref> Emma has an English-born partner Tim Stanton, also a personal trainer, and they had lived together in Sydney prior to Emma entering the Big Brother House.
Emma's father died on 16 May 2007<ref>{{cite news | url = http://edition.cnn.com/2007/WORLD/asiapcf/05/25/australia.brother.ap/ | title = 'Big Brother' defends death secret | author = The Associated Press | date=25 May 2007 | accessdate=27 May 2007 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20070531132331/http://edition.cnn.com/2007/WORLD/asiapcf/05/25/australia.brother.ap/ | archive-date=31 May 2007 | dead-url = yes | publisher = [[CNN.com]] }}</ref> whilst Emma was still in the Big Brother House and she was not advised of his death.<ref>{{cite news | url = http://www.theage.com.au/news/national/big-brother-housemate-not-told-of-her-fathers-death/2007/05/24/1179601576376.html | title = Big Brother housemate not told of her father's death | last = Dubecki | first = Larissa | date = 25 May 2007 | accessdate = 25 May 2007 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20070526151950/https://www.theage.com.au/news/national/big-brother-housemate-not-told-of-her-fathers-death/2007/05/24/1179601576376.html | archive-date = 26 May 2007 | dead-url = no | publisher = [[The Age]] }}</ref> Emma and her father had been estranged for six years although they had recently been communicating through text messages.<ref>{{cite news | url = http://www.theaustralian.news.com.au/story/0,20867,21790730-7582,00.html | title = Big Brother housemate not told of her father's death | last = Bodey | first = Michael | date = 25 May 2007 | accessdate = 28 May 2007 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20070526053007/http://www.theaustralian.news.com.au/story/0,20867,21790730-7582,00.html | archive-date = 26 May 2007 | dead-url = yes | publisher=[[The Australian]] }}</ref> Her father's dying wish was that Emma not be informed of his death until after she had left the Big Brother house. He had hoped that his death would not receive publicity, however news of his passing was leaked to the news media. Emma's brother Matt reported that their father had endured a long illness and the family had had some time to prepare themselves.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.thewest.com.au/aapstory.aspx?StoryName=385398 | title = BB's Emma was prepared for dad's death | author=AAP | date = 25 May 2007 | publisher=[[The West Australian]] | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070930024121/http://www.thewest.com.au/aapstory.aspx?StoryName=385398 | archive-date=30 September 2007 | dead-url = yes | accessdate = 25 May 2007 }}</ref> In an [https://web.archive.org/web/20070710210532/http://bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/news/A-letter-from-Emmas-brother-195.html open letter] to the Australian public, which was posted on the official Big Brother website, Matt Cornell explained that he and Emma had "discussed the possibility of dad’s death thoroughly. I can confirm with absolute confidence that Emma has prepared herself and her views have been considered in the family’s decision-making process."<ref>{{cite news| url = http://www.news.com.au/perthnow/story/0,21598,21793358-5005368,00.html |title=BB Emma's brother weighs in|author=AAP|first=|date=24 May 2007|work=|accessdate=27 May 2007|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070912050829/http://www.news.com.au/perthnow/story/0%2C21598%2C21793358-5005368%2C00.html|archivedate=12 September 2007|deadurl=yes|publisher=[[The Daily Telegraph (Sydney)|The Daily Telegraph]]}}</ref> This news has been reported internationally.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.metro.co.uk/news/article.html?in_article_id=50514&in_page_id=34|title=BB housemate not told father has died|author=<!-- No by-line -->|first=|date=25 May 2007|website=|publisher=[[Metro (Associated Metro Limited)|Metro]]|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070926225337/http://www.metro.co.uk/news/article.html?in_article_id=50514&in_page_id=34|archive-date=26 September 2007|dead-url=no|accessdate=25 May 2007}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ibnlive.com/news/showbiz/05_2007/reality-show-girl-unaware-of-dead-dad-41383.html|title=Reality show girl unaware of dead dad|author=CNN-IBN|first=|date=26 May 2007|website=|publisher=IBN Live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070528063619/http://www.ibnlive.com/news/showbiz/05_2007/reality-show-girl-unaware-of-dead-dad-41383.html|archive-date=28 May 2007|dead-url=yes|accessdate=27 May 2007}}</ref> The producers of the series confirmed that, on her eviction from the house, Emma would be advised of her father's death in private and away from television cameras.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.theage.com.au/news/tv--radio/leave-us-alone/2007/05/25/1179601635050.html|title=Emma's family: leave us alone|author=Molloy|first=Shannon|date=25 May 2007|work=|accessdate=27 May 2007|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070601045207/http://www.theage.com.au/news/tv--radio/leave-us-alone/2007/05/25/1179601635050.html|archive-date=1 June 2007|dead-url=no|publisher=[[The Age]]|location=Melbourne}}</ref>
On 28 May ''Big Brother'' producer [[Kris Noble]] wrote to the press saying that "we were not aware that Emma's father had died until it was disclosed to the press by persons unknown. This took place after the funeral service. This in turn led to media speculation that the producers of ''Big Brother'' chose not to tell Emma about her father's death and would somehow use the tragedy as a grab for ratings, causing further distress for the family who wanted to keep their sad news private."<ref>{{cite news | title = <!-- Offline newspaper cited, no headline listed, article cannot be found online --> | date = 28 May 2007 | work = [[mX (newspaper)|mX]] | page = 14 }}</ref><ref>[[Herald Sun]], Tuesday 29 May 2007, p 16.<!-- need title to locate article online --></ref> On the evening of 28 May, during the staging of the live ''Nominations'' show two audience members held up a sign reading "Emma, Your Dad Is Dead", presumably hoping a housemate would see it during a live cross between host Gretel Killeen and the housemates during the program. However, the ''Nomination'' show features no live crosses; these are in fact a feature of ''Eviction'' shows. They were discovered and ejected from the audience.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.news.com.au/heraldsun/story/0,21985,21819601-2902,00.html|title=Fans show 'Dad Is Dead' sign|author=Harris|first=Amy|date=30 May 2007|work=|accessdate=2 June 2007|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070601162407/http://www.news.com.au/heraldsun/story/0,21985,21819601-2902,00.html|archive-date=1 June 2007|dead-url=yes|publisher=[[Herald Sun]]}}</ref>
Emma is the eighth housemate to be evicted, on Day 50, by public voting with 76% of the merged vote, along with Rebecca in a double eviction. Emma had been informed of her father's death during a meeting with her brother Matt and a psychologist, 24 hours prior to her eviction. The issue of her father's death was only briefly mentioned when Emma appeared on the stage during the eviction show. Emma stated that "I want to leave it alone tonight as was my father's wish."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.news.com.au/heraldsun/story/0,21985,21883344-5005961,00.html|title=Emma evicted from Big Brother|author=<!-- no by-line -->|first=|date=10 June 2007|work=|accessdate=10 June 2007|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070613095816/http://www.news.com.au/heraldsun/story/0%2C21985%2C21883344-5005961%2C00.html|archivedate=13 June 2007|deadurl=yes|publisher=[[Sunday Herald Sun]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/news/Emmas-Evicted-Statement-from-Big-Brother-Producers-307.html | title = Emma Evicted: Statement from Big Brother producers | date = 10 June 2007 | publisher = Ten official site | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20070612143152/http://bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/news/Emmas-Evicted-Statement-from-Big-Brother-Producers-307.html | archive-date = 12 June 2007 | dead-url = yes }}</ref> After two weeks of doing public appearances for Big Brother she cancelled all future appearances.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.ninemsn.com.au/article.aspx?id=275227|title=BB's Emma cancels public appearances|author=ninemsn staff|first=|date=26 June 2007|website=|publisher=[[ninemsn|news.ninemsn.com.au]]|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070714141546/http://news.ninemsn.com.au/article.aspx?id=275227|archive-date=14 July 2007|dead-url=yes|accessdate=2 July 2007}}</ref> Journalist Amy Harris opined that, with the knowledge that her father was gravely ill at the time, Cornell "should not have been included in this series. Period." Harris reported that Cornell later refused to discuss the matter with the free press, but later sold the story to a "tabloid magazine".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.news.com.au/couriermail/story/0,23739,22162402-953,00.html|title=Hits and misses in 2007|author=Harris|first=Amy|date=30 July 2007|work=|accessdate=31 July 2007|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110811065811/http://www.couriermail.com.au/news/national/hits-and-misses-in-2007/story-e6freooo-1111114073950 <!-- this is the earliest archive, even though it's from 2011 -->|archive-date=11 August 2011|dead-url=yes|publisher=[[The Courier-Mail]]}}</ref>
=== Hayley === '''Hayley Luscott'''<ref name="vicsdominate">{{cite news|url=http://www.news.com.au/heraldsun/story/0,,21599753-2902,00.html|title=Vics dominate BB house|author=Byrne|first=Fiona|date=22 April 2007|work=|accessdate=25 April 2007|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090220172100/http://www.news.com.au/heraldsun/story/0,,21599753-2902,00.html|archive-date=20 February 2009 <!-- this is the first archive -->|dead-url=yes|publisher=[[Herald Sun]]}}</ref> (born 22 February 1983) is a law graduate from [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]] and was a [[Female bodybuilding|body sculpture]] champion.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.teenbodybuilding.com/james63.htm|title=An interview with Hayley Zalewski|author=Sadek|first=James|date=20 February 2005|website=|publisher=TeenBodyBuilding.com|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160207134515/https://www.bodybuilding.com/fun/teen-james63.htm|archive-date=7 February 2016|dead-url=no|accessdate=25 April 2007}}</ref> She describes herself as intelligent, fun and compassionate.<ref name="Hayley">{{Cite web|url=http://www.bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/housemate-bio.html?id=7|title=Hayley's Biography|last=|first=|date=|website=Ten Official Site|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070514124548/http://www.bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/housemate-bio.html?id=7|archive-date=14 May 2007|dead-url=yes|access-date=}}</ref> She was in a relationship with housemate Andrew which was being kept secret from the other housemates as a week one challenge set by Big Brother. In week five Big Brother decided that it was time to remove a member of the couple, and Andrew and Hayley were required by Big Brother to decide between them which of them should leave. She chose to leave and so was evicted by Big Brother on Day 31, becoming the fifth evictee.<ref name="Andrew Temmet" /> After Big Brother 2007, Hayley and Andrew have ended their relationship. Hayley blamed Big Brother for their breakup.
=== Jamie === '''[[Jamie McDonald (media personality)|Jamie McDonald]]'''<ref name="Jamie" /> (born 27 March 1978) was a karaoke host and self-proclaimed nerd originally from [[Ballarat]], [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]]. He grew up in an orphanage until the age of six. Jamie has had over 30 different jobs in his life including singing waiter, adult bookshop manager, magician's assistant, trench digger, opera singer, pizza delivery driver, karaoke host, loss prevention officer (store detective). He used to be a host on [[Channel 31 Melbourne]] video game show ''[[Level 3 (TV series)|Level 3]]''.<ref name="Jamie">{{Cite web|url=http://www.bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/housemate-bio.html?id=8|title=Jamie's Biography|last=|first=|date=|website=Ten Official Site|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070425205120/http://bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/housemate-bio.html?id=8|archive-date=25 April 2007|dead-url=yes|access-date=|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Jamie is the thirteenth housemate to be evicted, on Day 71, by public voting with 25% of the merged vote. Jamie now works as a radio personality hosting a network shift and has been connected to [[Southern Cross Austereo]], [[Fairfax Media]] and Super Radio Network stations.
=== Joel === '''Joel Scalzi'''<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.news.com.au/adelaidenow/story/0,22606,21593509-2682,00.html|title=Ex MP's son is BB hopeful|author=Forrest|first=Leith|date=21 April 2007|work=Adelaide Now|accessdate=25 April 2007|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070503184204/http://www.news.com.au/adelaidenow/story/0,22606,21593509-2682,00.html|archive-date=3 May 2007|dead-url=yes|publisher=[[The Advertiser (Australia)|The Advertiser]]}}</ref> (born 16 July 1983) is a restaurant manager from [[South Australia]] and is of [[Italy|Italian]] heritage. He is the son of teacher and former politician [[Joe Scalzi]]<ref name="vicsdominate" /> and describes himself as charismatic and hilarious. Joel claims to have never had a girlfriend in his life. Joel has an undecided future and has been thinking of both his tennis and political careers in the house. Statistically, he had also been the worst player on Friday Night Live, and was constantly reminded of this fact by Big Brother, until he won the event in Week 11.<ref name="Joel">{{Cite web|url=http://www.bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/housemate-bio.html?id=9|title=Joel's Biography|last=|first=|date=|website=Ten official site|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070425204758/http://www.bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/housemate-bio.html?id=9|archive-date=25 April 2007|dead-url=yes|access-date=}}</ref> He is the seventeenth housemate to be evicted, on Day 92 with 7% of the vote, along with Zoran in a double eviction.
=== Kate === '''Kate Gladman'''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.geelongadvertiser.com.au/article/2007/04/24/3164_news.html|title=Big Brother contestant urged to keep her clothes on|author=Tucker|first=Rebecca|date=24 April 2007|website=|publisher=[[Geelong Advertiser]]|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070818054542/http://www.geelongadvertiser.com.au/article/2007/04/24/3164_news.html|archive-date=18 August 2007|dead-url=yes|accessdate=25 April 2007}}</ref> (born 1981) is an enquiry officer and law graduate from [[Geelong]], [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]], and was once offered a position at [[Oxford University]] in [[United Kingdom|Britain]]. She describes her perfect relationship as "being single" and describes herself as heavenly and fabulous.<ref name="Kate">{{Cite web|url=http://www.bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/housemate-bio.html?id=10|title=Kate's Biography|last=|first=|date=|website=Ten official site|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070425204614/http://www.bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/housemate-bio.html?id=10|archive-date=25 April 2007|dead-url=yes|access-date=}}</ref> On Day 11, 2 May 2007, Kate revealed that she had a child who died in birth, eighteen months before this series started, as a result of the rare disease [[pre-eclampsia]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.geelongadvertiser.com.au/article/2007/05/05/3489_news.html|title=Big Brother says sorry to Kate|author=Pike|first=Lauren|date=5 May 2007|website=|publisher=[[Geelong Advertiser]]|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070928031654/http://www.geelongadvertiser.com.au/article/2007/05/05/3489_news.html|archive-date=28 September 2007|dead-url=yes|accessdate=6 May 2007}}</ref> The revelation came after the house mates were assigned a task involving the care of artificial babies. The task was cancelled due to Kate's evidently traumatic reaction to it where she asked to leave the house. As a result of this Big Brother cancelled the task, and Kate chose to stay. The producers knew about the death of Kate's baby. In a press release, Producer Kris Noble stated the producers had discussed it with Kate before she entered the competition, and she had said she was over it. However, he later admitted that it had nevertheless been a misjudgment to assign such a task and that, despite her claims, they should have been more sensitive.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.news.com.au/couriermail/story/0,23739,21832053-5003422,00.html|title=BB has turned nasty|author=Harris|first=Amy|date=2 June 2007|work=|accessdate=2 June 2007|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070604234211/http://www.news.com.au/couriermail/story/0,23739,21832053-5003422,00.html|archive-date=4 June 2007|dead-url=yes|publisher=[[The Courier Mail]]}}</ref> Kate is the first housemate to be evicted, on Day 15, by public voting with 55% of the merged vote.
=== Laura === '''Laura Clare'''<ref name="Laura Clare">{{cite news|url=http://www.news.com.au/entertainment/story/0,23663,22150667-10229,00.html|title=Big Brother party girl arrested|author=Weston|first=Paul|date=29 July 2007|work=|accessdate=29 July 2007|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070921054645/http://www.news.com.au/entertainment/story/0,23663,22150667-10229,00.html|archive-date=21 September 2007|dead-url=yes|publisher=[[The Sunday Mail (Brisbane)|The Sunday Mail]]}}</ref> (born 1987) is a receptionist from [[Tasmania]]. She is an Intruder who entered the house on Day 31 on a special [[Big Brother Australia 2007#Intruder Alert!|Intruder Alert!]] show.<ref name="Daniela" /> She describes herself as down to earth, and claims [[Al Gore]] as her hero.<ref name="Laura bio">{{Cite web|url=http://bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/housemate-bio.html?id=21|title=Laura's Biography|last=|first=|date=|website=Ten official site|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070523075227/http://bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/news/Lil-Sis-Meet-the-Intruders-171.html|archive-date=23 May 2007|dead-url=yes|access-date=}}</ref> She is a self-described conservationist and composed a 30-second song to ensure she only spends 30 seconds daily in the shower. She is the tenth housemate to be evicted, on Day 57, by public voting with 43% of the merged vote. On 28 July 2007 Laura appeared in the Southport Magistrates Court where she was fined $600 after pleading guilty to several charges including headbutting and eating hotdogs in front of a police officer. She was charged but not convicted. Due to the incident Laura was not invited to attend and participate in the Big Brother 2007 closing show while all other former Big Brother housemates, wildcards and intruders were in attendance.<ref name="Laura Clare" /> Since then Laura has successfully pursued a modelling and singing career.
=== Michelle === '''Michelle Olsen'''<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.news.com.au/heraldsun/story/0,21985,22044670-28957,00.html|title=Michelle swears she's no toughie|author=|first=|date=10 July 2007|work=|accessdate=10 July 2007|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070714031254/http://www.news.com.au/heraldsun/story/0,21985,22044670-28957,00.html|archive-date=14 July 2007|dead-url=yes|publisher=[[Herald Sun]]}}</ref> is a retailer from [[Western Australia]]. === Nick === '''Nick Sady'''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.geelongadvertiser.com.au/article/2007/05/11/3631_news.html|title=Big Brother: Belmont boy in the house|author=McNamara|first=Julie|date=11 May 2007|website=|publisher=[[Geelong Advertiser]]|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070517084214/http://www.geelongadvertiser.com.au/article/2007/05/11/3631_news.html|archivedate=17 May 2007|deadurl=yes|accessdate=11 May 2007}}</ref> (born 1981) is a nurse who entered the house on Day 18 via the [[#Golden Key|Starburst Golden Key]] promotion. Nick is openly [[gay]] and admits being [[arachnophobic]]. He was randomly selected from the five chosen finalists taken from the pool of 100 [[#Big Brother Starburst Golden Key|Starburst Golden Key]] winners. He is the sixth housemate to be evicted, on Day 36, with 51% of the merged vote.
=== Rebecca === '''Rebecca Dent'''<ref name="Rebecca Dent">{{cite news|url=http://www.news.com.au/story/0,23599,21636537-2,00.html|title=Mormon mum defends teetotaller|author=Tsitouris|first=Helen|date=29 April 2007|work=|accessdate=19 May 2007|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070603101154/http://www.news.com.au/story/0%2C23599%2C21636537-2%2C00.html|archivedate=3 June 2007|deadurl=yes|publisher=[[The Sunday Mail (Brisbane)|The Sunday Mail]]|df=}}</ref> (born 1983) is an events manager from [[Queensland]]. She is a [[Mormon]], who has said that she has not ever consumed alcohol or worn a bikini. She describes herself as vibrant, bubbly and open.<ref name="Rebecca">{{Cite web|url=http://www.bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/housemate-bio.html?id=11|title=Rebecca's Biography|last=|first=|date=|website=Ten official site|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070425204531/http://www.bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/housemate-bio.html?id=11|archive-date=25 April 2007|dead-url=yes|access-date=}}</ref> Rebecca's mother expressed her angst over her daughter being excluded from some housemate activities because of her religious choices. She is the ninth housemate to be evicted, on Day 50, by public voting with 4% of the merged vote, along with Emma in a double eviction. Since her time in the house, Rebecca has found success in radio, initially in Gladstone. She was part of Hot FM's "Marty & Bec Breakfast Show" in Cairns, hosted Southern Cross Ten's "Landed Music" and was part of the breakfast team at hot fm in townsville. In 2013 "Bec" moved to Red Deer, Alberta, Canada and is the co-host of "The Big Breakfast Show" on Big105 FM.
=== Susannah === '''Susannah Murray'''<ref name="Susannah Murray">{{cite news|url=http://www.news.com.au/heraldsun/story/0,21985,21847153-28957,00.html|title=BB wildcard with new beau|author=|first=|date=5 June 2007|work=|accessdate=6 June 2007|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070606122225/http://www.news.com.au/heraldsun/story/0,21985,21847153-28957,00.html|archive-date=6 June 2007|dead-url=yes|publisher=[[Herald Sun]]}}</ref> (born 1977) was a fraud analyst from [[Toorak, Victoria|Toorak]], Victoria (originally from [[Brisbane]]). According to the Big Brother website, she used to work in several dating agencies, has [[arachnophobia]], and fears getting trapped in large bodies of water. She is one of the two housemates voted into the house by public SMS vote, along with Zoran.<ref name="Susannah">{{Cite web|url=http://www.bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/housemate-bio.html?id=15|title=Susannah's Biography|last=|first=|date=|website=Ten official site|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070425204914/http://www.bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/housemate-bio.html?id=15|archive-date=25 April 2007|dead-url=yes|access-date=}}</ref> She is the seventh housemate to be evicted, on Day 43, by public voting with 47% of the merged vote. During the series she went through a type of [[mid-life crisis]], having turned 30, and thinking her life was over.<ref name="S T">{{cite news|url=http://www.news.com.au/dailytelegraph/story/0,22049,22094466-5006002,00.html|title=BB girl runs off with housemate|author=|first=|date=19 July 2007|work=|accessdate=19 July 2007|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081227145511/http://www.news.com.au/dailytelegraph/story/0,22049,22094466-5006002,00.html|archive-date=27 December 2008|dead-url=yes|publisher=[[The Daily Telegraph (Sydney)|The Daily Telegraph]]}}</ref>
=== Thomas === '''Thomas Haynes''' (born 1980) is a real estate agent from [[Western Australia]]. He is a former professional basketballer who holds degrees in chemistry and human biology. Thomas is {{convert|6|ft|6|in|cm}} tall. He describes himself as fun, confused and genuine.<ref name="Thomas">{{Cite web|url=http://www.bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/housemate-bio.html?id=12|title=Thomas's Biography|last=|first=|date=|website=Ten official site|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070425204955/http://www.bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/housemate-bio.html?id=12|archive-date=25 April 2007|dead-url=yes|access-date=}}</ref> At the time he entered the house, he was separated from his wife. He is the twelfth housemate to be evicted, on Day 64, by public voting with 22% of the merged vote, along with Andrew in a double eviction.
=== TJ === '''Theresa Jane "TJ" Whitlock'''<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.ntnews.com.au/article/2008/06/21/4443_ntnews.html|title=Bad girls bite back|last=Cunningham|first=Matt|date=21 June 2008|work=|accessdate=21 June 2008|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120212191459/http://www.ntnews.com.au/article/2008/06/21/4443_ntnews.html|archive-date=12 February 2012|dead-url=yes|publisher=Northern Territory News}}</ref> (born 1 July 1985) was a bar attendant from [[Darwin, Northern Territory|Darwin]], [[Northern Territory]]. She describes herself as "unique, bizarre, and complex".<ref name="TJ">{{Cite web|url=http://www.bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/housemate-bio.html?id=13|title=TJ's Biography|website=Ten official website|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070425204444/http://www.bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/housemate-bio.html?id=13|archive-date=25 April 2007|dead-url=yes}}</ref> TJ had a tempestuous relationship with fellow housemate Bodie while in the house.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.theage.com.au/news/tv--radio/a-study-in-humiliation/2007/05/16/1178995169008.html?s_cid=rss_age|title=TJ: a study in humiliation|last=Schembri|first=Jim|date=17 May 2007|work=The Age|access-date=|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160121095916/http://www.theage.com.au/news/tv--radio/a-study-in-humiliation/2007/05/16/1178995169008.html?s_cid=rss_age|archive-date=21 January 2016|dead-url=no|location=Melbourne}}</ref> She is the second housemate to be evicted, on Day 22, by public voting with 54% of the merged vote, along with on-again off-again boyfriend Bodie, in a double eviction. TJ had a friendly personality, but with a fiery temper, particularly towards Bodie and Thomas.<ref>http://www.ntnews.com.au/article/2010/01/20/117241_entertainment.html<nowiki/>{{Dead link|date=May 2018}}</ref>
=== Travis === '''Travis Perkins'''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starnewsgroup.com.au/story/41361|title=Oh brother, Travis is living the dream|author=Grant|first=Melissa|date=9 May 2007|website=Star News Group|publisher=Pakenham Gazette / Berwick Gazette|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070929092613/http://www.starnewsgroup.com.au/story/41361|archive-date=29 September 2007|dead-url=yes|accessdate=19 May 2007}}</ref> (born 1975) is a truck driver from [[Pakenham, Victoria|Pakenham]], Victoria, who works for [[Safeway (Australia)|Safeway]]. He describes himself as straight-up, honest and caring.<ref name="Travis">{{Cite web|url=http://www.bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/housemate-bio.html?id=14|title=Travis' Biography|last=|first=|date=|website=Ten official site|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070425205314/http://www.bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/housemate-bio.html?id=14|archive-date=25 April 2007|dead-url=yes|access-date=}}</ref> He was a child model and is currently married with a son named Jesse, who was born with a rare condition in which he cannot grow teeth. Travis missed Jesse's third birthday on Day 84. Travis was chosen for the 2004 Big Brother house but chose not to enter as his wife was pregnant at the time.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.news.com.au/heraldsun/story/0,21985,22064143-5012974,00.html|title=Dad to miss Jesse's day|author=|first=|date=13 July 2007|work=|accessdate=13 July 2007|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090220172300/http://www.news.com.au/heraldsun/story/0,21985,22064143-5012974,00.html|archive-date=20 February 2009|dead-url=yes|publisher=[[Herald Sun]]}}</ref> He had long been considered a favourite to win this series of Big Brother, however, two weeks before the finale, there was a lot of backlash with speculation as to whether his "ocker" character was genuine.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.news.com.au/entertainment/story/0,23663,22093871-5012688,00.html|title=Is Big Brother's Travis a boofhead or a fraud?|author=Montgomery|first=Garth|date=18 July 2007|work=|accessdate=18 July 2007|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080513043220/http://www.news.com.au/entertainment/story/0%2C23663%2C22093871-5012688%2C00.html|archivedate=13 May 2008|deadurl=yes|publisher=[[The Daily Telegraph (Sydney)|The Daily Telegraph]]}}</ref> On Day 99, Travis was evicted with 18% of the merged save votes, finishing in third place.
=== Zach === '''Zach Douglas'''<ref name="Kris Zach" /> (age 24) is a [[corsetiere]] from [[Echuca]], [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]]. He entered the house on Day 50 as an Intruder alongside [[Big Brother Australia 2007#Michelle|Michelle]] during the Double Eviction / Double Intruder special. He is openly [[homosexuality|gay]]<ref name="New Intruders" /> and describes himself as compassionate, loveable and one-in-a-million.<ref name="Zach">{{Cite web|url=http://bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/housemate-bio.html?id=24|title=Zach's Biography|last=|first=|date=|website=Ten Official site|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070612143117/http://bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/housemate-bio.html?id=24|archive-date=12 June 2007|dead-url=yes|access-date=}}</ref> As a corsetiere he works for his own label, Zach Douglas Designs.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ssonet.com.au/display.asp?ArticleID=6815|title=Coming out of the Big Brother house|author=Davis|first=Cara|date=2 August 2007|website=Sydney Star Observer|publisher=|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070927005421/http://www.ssonet.com.au/display.asp?ArticleID=6815|archivedate=27 September 2007|dead-url=yes|accessdate=1 August 2007}}</ref> He was the first Intruder to make the final two in Big Brother Australia. He was announced runner-up to Aleisha with 49% of the vote, making it the closest Big Brother Australian finale ever. His achievement as runner-up has been supported by the gay community.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.afterelton.com/blog/lylemasaki/a-gay-man-makes-it-to-the-final-two-of-big-brother-australia?comment=24941|title=A gay man makes it to the final two of Big Brother Australia|author=Masaki|first=Lyle|date=31 July 2007|website=|publisher=''AfterElton.com''|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090216200351/http://www.afterelton.com/blog/lylemasaki/a-gay-man-makes-it-to-the-final-two-of-big-brother-australia?comment=24941|archive-date=16 February 2009|dead-url=yes|accessdate=4 August 2007}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.samesame.com.au/news/local/1133/Big_Brother%E2%80%99s_Zach_Bring_On_The_Boys|title=Big Brother’s Zach: Bring On The Boys|author=Tim D|first=|date=1 August 2007|website=|publisher=''SameSame.com.au''|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070930015437/http://www.samesame.com.au/news/local/1133/Big_Brother%E2%80%99s_Zach_Bring_On_The_Boys|archivedate=30 September 2007|deadurl=yes|accessdate=4 August 2007}}</ref>
===Zoran===<!-- This section is linked from [[Big Brother Australia 2007 Highlights]] --> '''Zoran Vidinovski'''<ref name="Zoranfull">{{Cite web|url=http://www.techfusion.com.au/room908/index.asp?pid=1|title=Biography of Zoran Zak Vidinovski|last=|first=|date=|website=Room Nine08|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070921060501/http://www.techfusion.com.au/room908/index.asp|archive-date=21 September 2007|dead-url=yes|access-date=}}</ref> (born 1984) is a club coordinator from [[Queensland]] and is of [[ethnic Macedonians|Macedonian]] heritage. He says that the best feature about his body is his eyes. He is one of the two housemates voted into the house by public SMS vote. He lost 15 kilograms prior to entering the house.<ref name="Zoran">{{Cite web|url=http://www.bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/housemate-bio.html?id=16|title=Zoran's Biography|last=|first=|date=|website=Ten Official Site|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070426004324/http://www.bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/housemate-bio.html?id=16|archive-date=26 April 2007|dead-url=yes|access-date=}}</ref> He is the eighteenth housemate to be evicted, on Day 92, with 1% of the merged vote, along with Joel in a double eviction.
== White Room Wild Cards == ===Cruz===<!-- This section is linked from [[Big Brother Australia 2007 Highlights]] --> '''Travers "Cruz" Chue'''<ref name="Cruz">{{Cite web|url=http://www.edmundrice.org/education/content/60501.html|title=Coup for Nudgee's Fashionistas|last=|first=|date=|website=Edmund Rice|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20061020120214/http://www.edmundrice.org/education/content/60501.html|archive-date=20 October 2006|dead-url=yes|access-date=}}</ref> (born 1984) is a fashion designer from [[Queensland]]. He was the first wildcard to press the red button and leave the White Room on Day 8, after being tempted by Big Brother to leave for A$750. [[Gretel Killeen]] later hinted that the money would have greatly increased if he had delayed.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/news.html?id=77|title=Cruz you lose|last=|first=|date=29 April 2007|website=Ten official site|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070502024520/http://www.bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/news.html?id=77|archive-date=2 May 2007|dead-url=yes|access-date=}}</ref>
=== Harrison === '''Harrison Rhoades''' is a carpenter and [[scuba diving]] instructor from [[Sydney]]. He was the third housemate to be eliminated from the White Room through voting by the current housemates.
=== Kara === '''Kara Otter''' is a retail assistant from [[New South Wales]]. She was the second person to be eliminated from the White Room, by nomination from Demet and Harrison.
== Celebrity Intruder == '''[[Kyle Sandilands]]''', former [[Celebrity Big Brother Australia]] contestant and radio host, entered the house on Day 84<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/news/Kyle-enters-the-BB-House-602.html|title=Kyle enters the BB House|last=|first=|date=11 July 2007|website=Ten official site|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070824194404/http://bigbrother.3mobile.com.au/news/Kyle-enters-the-BB-House-602.html|archive-date=24 August 2007|dead-url=yes|access-date=}}</ref> and was supposed to stay as an "intruder" until Day 87, but left the house after only a day due to a severe migraine. He was set a secret task by Big Brother during a special show before the Live Eviction 12 show on Day 83, to challenge the housemates to speak up and stop flying under the radar. He was supposed to broadcast his radio show, ''[[The Kyle and Jackie O Show]]'', from the house on Day 87.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.theaustralian.news.com.au/story/0,20867,22055504-1702,00.html|title=Sandilands new Big Brother intruder|author=AAP|first=|date=11 July 2007|work=|accessdate=12 July 2007|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090220160317/http://www.theaustralian.news.com.au/story/0,20867,22055504-1702,00.html|archive-date=20 February 2009|dead-url=yes|publisher=[[The Australian]]}}</ref> During his short stay in the house he had a short showdown with Big Brother after being asked to remove his hat whilst in the Diary Room. Big Brother refused to speak to him until he did, causing Kyle to swear at Big Brother and eventually force his way out of the room using a microphone stand. His stated reason for leaving was having a severe [[migraine]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.news.com.au/entertainment/story/0,23663,22081335-10388,00.html|title=Big Brother doctors vot Kyle Sandilands out|author=Sydney Confidential|first=|date=16 July 2007|work=|accessdate=16 July 2007|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090220190721/http://www.news.com.au/entertainment/story/0,23663,22081335-10388,00.html|archive-date=20 February 2009|dead-url=yes|publisher=[[The Daily Telegraph (Sydney)|The Daily Telegraph]]}}</ref> It has been speculated that his real reasons for leaving were that he was not given the star treatment he had expected, and that Big Brother had lied to him.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.news.com.au/heraldsun/story/0,21985,22078288-5005961,00.html|title=Kyle exits Big Brother house with 'migraine'|author=AAP|first=|date=15 July 2007|work=|accessdate=15 July 2007|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070717203118/http://www.news.com.au/heraldsun/story/0%2C21985%2C22078288-5005961%2C00.html|archivedate=17 July 2007|deadurl=yes|publisher=[[Herald Sun|Sunday Herald Sun]]}}</ref>

{{pp-semi|small=yes}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2012}} ''Parent article:'' [[List of gay, lesbian or bisexual people]];
''Siblings:''
{{List LGBT short}} {{Dynamic list}} This is a partial list of confirmed '''famous people who were or are [[gay]], [[lesbian]] or [[bisexuality|bisexual]]'''. Famous people who are simply rumored to be gay, lesbian or bisexual, are not listed. The historical concept and [[definition]] of [[sexual orientation]] varies and has changed greatly over time; for example the word "gay" wasn't used to describe sexual orientation until the mid 20th century. A number of different classification schemes have been used to describe sexual orientation since the mid-19th century, and scholars have often defined the term "sexual orientation" in divergent ways. Indeed, several studies have found that much of the research about sexual orientation has failed to define the term at all, making it difficult to reconcile the results of different studies.{{Cite journal |last=Shively |first=M.G. |author2=Jones, C. |author3=DeCecco, J. P. |year=1984 |title=Research on sexual orientation: definitions and methods |journal=Journal of Homosexuality |volume= 9 |issue= 2/3 |pages=127–137 |doi=10.1300/J082v09n02_08 |pmid=6376622 }}{{Cite book|last=Gerdes |first=L.C. |title=The Developing Adult | edition=Second |location=Durban: Butterworths; Austin, Texas |publisher=Butterworth Legal Publishers |year=1988 |isbn=0-409-10188-5}}{{Cite journal|last=Sell |first=Randall L. |date=December 1997 |title=Defining and Measuring Sexual Orientation: A Review: How do you define sexual orientation? |journal=Archives of Sexual Behavior |volume= 26|pmid=9415799 |issue= 6 |pages=643–658 |url=https://www.pbs.org/wgbh/pages/frontline/shows/assault/context/defining.html |doi=10.1023/A:1024528427013 |accessdate=11 July 2007}} However, most definitions include a psychological component (such as the direction of an individual's erotic desire) and/or a behavioural component (which focuses on the sex of the individual's sexual partner/s). Some prefer to simply follow an individual's self-definition or [[Identity (social science)|identity]]. See homosexuality and [[bisexuality]] for criteria that have traditionally denoted lesbian, gay and bisexual ([[LGBT|LGB]]) people. The high prevalence of people from the West on this list may be due to [[societal attitudes towards homosexuality]]. The [[Pew Research Center]]'s 2003 Global Attitudes Survey found that "[p]eople in Africa and the Middle East strongly object to societal acceptance of homosexuality. But there is far greater tolerance for homosexuality in major Latin American countries such as Mexico, Argentina, Bolivia and Brazil. Opinion in Europe is split between West and East. Majorities in every Western European nation surveyed say homosexuality should be accepted by society, while most Russians, Poles and Ukrainians disagree. Americans are divided – a thin majority (51 percent) believes homosexuality should be accepted, while 42 percent disagree."{{Cite book|last=Pew Global Attitudes Project |title=Views of a Changing World |url=http://pewglobal.org/reports/display.php?ReportID=185 |format=.PDF |date=June 2003 |location=Washington, D.C. |publisher=The Pew Research Center For The People & The Press | oclc=52547041 |accessdate=11 July 2007}}

{{BLP sources|date=May 2009}} '''Marina Tsvigun''' (Марина Цвигун), or '''Maria Devi Christos''' by assumed name, (born 1960) is a religious sect leader of the New Community of Enlightened Humanity, also known as "YUSMALOS" (YUS - Youann Swami [AKA Yuri Krivonogov, her co-founder], MA - Maria, and the word Logos, for Jesus){{cite book|last1=Abanes|first1=Richard|title=End-Time Visions: The Road to Armagedddon?|date=April 1998|publisher=Four Walls Eight Windows|location=New York/London|isbn=1-56858-104-1|page=17}} or [[Great White Brotherhood|"The Great White Brotherhood"]]. Following the collapse of the Soviet Union it was one of the conspicuous New Age movements in the former republics, with about 80,000 members by official count.Anastasia Daugule, "White Brotherhood - 15 years later". "Glavnoe" Kharkiv Net Review, a1404 == Biography == TsvigunVladimir Tikhomirov, "The Criminal Goddess". "Ogonyok" #42 October 17–23, 2005 was born in 1960 in [[Donetsk|Stalino]], [[Ukrainian SSR]], [[USSR]]. She served as a functionary for the Young Communist League district committee, worked as a newspaper journalist and an editor for Donetsk textile factory radio network.
In 1990 she attended lectures by Yuri Krivonogov, the "White Brotherhood" co-founder, who recognized Tsvigun as a new messiah and later received the role of "Higher Priest" of the Great White Brotherhood.
The members were required to renounce their family ties and donate money and property to the Brotherhood. The Great White Brotherhood came into conflict with the [[Russian Orthodox Church]]. == Arrest and imprisonment == Tsvigun predictedSergei Tereshchenko. "Great White Brotherhood Universal Church". Center for Apologetic Studies the Time of Apocalypse and the coming of the Holy Spirit on November 10, 1993. The event was supposed to be accompanied by her sermons in the Sophia Cathedral. On the appointed day, the members of the Brotherhood stormed the [[Saint Sophia Cathedral in Kiev]] and were arrested. According to the report of the Orthodox Church, Kiev City Court found Tsvigun and Krivonogov guilty of violating citizens' health under the guise of religious ceremonies and seizing by force. They were sentenced to 4 and 7 years in prison. The White Brotherhood protested to the United Nations and the International Court. Six months later, in August 1997, Tsvigun was freed as a part of an amnesty on the 6th anniversary of the independence of Ukraine. == After prison == After serving the term, Tsvigun changed her name and surname to Victoria Victorovna Preobrazhenskaya and married John-Peter II, a brotherhood member (real name Peter Kovalchuk). Under the name of Victoria, she started a new multidimensional project [http://www.victoriara.com "Cosmic Poliart of the Third Millennium of Victoria Preobrazhenskaya"] and tried to renew the Great White Brotherhood registration as a public organization, which was denied. She continued her activities and organized "The Mystic College of [[Isis]] and Her Followers." As of November 2008, she lives in Russia, where she runs an art gallery "Dom Solntsa". She published doctrine pamphlets "The Science about Light and Its Transformation" (available in Russian) and "The Last Testament of the Mother of the World", both written by her in prison. In 2011 she started a new magazine called “Victoria RA”, which is available on her website. ==See also== *[[List of people who have claimed to be Jesus]] ==Notes== ==External links== *[http://www.usmalos.narod.ru The “Great White Brotherhood” ] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20090728043614/http://glavnoe.kharkov.ua/articles/a1404 "White Brotherhood - 15 years later"] *[https://www.webcitation.org/6CVycOjXA?url=http://www.ogoniok.com/4916/36/ "The Criminal Goddess"] *[http://www.apologetika.ru/win/index.php3?razd=1&id1=27&id2=271 Center for Apologetic Studies] *[http://www.victoriara.com/ Cosmic Poliart of Victoria Preobrazhenskaya (Maria DEVI Christos)] {{DEFAULTSORT:Tsvigun, Marina}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:New religious movements]] [[Category:People from Donetsk]] [[Category:Self-declared messiahs]] [[Category:1960 births]] [[Category:Female religious leaders]]

'''Christoph Martin Killias''' (born March 29, 1948 in [[Zurich]], [[Switzerland]])<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.unisg.ch/~/media/internet/content/dateien/unisg/schools/ls/lehrstuhl%20killias/cv%2005%20with%20presentations290515.pdf | title=Martin Killias CV | accessdate=22 November 2015}}</ref> is a Swiss criminologist who has been a permanent visiting professor at the [[University of St. Gallen]]'s law school since 2013.<ref name=honorary>{{cite web | url=https://www.unisg.ch/en/hsgservices/hsgmediacorner/aktuell/rssnews/leute/2013/dezember/ehrendoktor-martinkillias-12dezember2013 | title=Honorary doctorate for Martin Killias | publisher=University of St. Gallen | date=12 December 2013 | accessdate=22 November 2015}}</ref> He is also the co-chair of the [[Campbell Collaboration]]'s Crime and Justice Group.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.campbellcollaboration.org/news_/New_co-chair_of_the_Crime_and_Justice.php | title=New co-chair of the Crime and Justice group | work=Campbell Collaboration | accessdate=20 February 2016}}</ref>
==Career== From 1986 to 2006, Killias was a professor of Criminal Law, Criminal Procedural Law and Criminology at the [[University of Lausanne]] and Director of that University’s Institute of Criminology and Criminal Law.<ref name=honorary/> From 1984 to 2008, he was also a part-time judge at the [[Federal Supreme Court of Switzerland|Swiss Federal Court]].<ref name=honorary/>
==Research== One study conducted by Killias looked at 18 different countries and found a moderate correlation between gun ownership rates and homicide rates across these countries, as well as a much stronger correlation between gun ownership rates and suicide rates.<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Killias|first1=M|title=International correlations between gun ownership and rates of homicide and suicide.|journal=CMAJ : Canadian Medical Association Journal |date=15 May 1993|volume=148|issue=10|pages=1721–5|pmid=8485675|pmc=1485564}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.nytimes.com/1996/03/10/weekinreview/ideas-trends-guns-one-nation-bars-the-other-requires.html?pagewanted=all | title=Guns: One Nation Bars, The Other Requires | work=New York Times | date=10 March 1996 | accessdate=22 November 2015 | author=Kristof, Nicholas}}</ref> Another study by him found that gun ownership in Switzerland may have increased domestic crime rates in that country.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.ibtimes.com/us-gun-control-debate-what-can-we-learn-switzerland-732104 | title=In The U.S. Gun Control Debate, What Can We Learn From Switzerland? | work=International Business Times | date=26 July 2012 | accessdate=22 November 2015 | author=Fortin, Jacey}}</ref>
==Views on gun violence== Killias has said that "the fewer guns there are in cellars, attics and armoires, then that would be helpful, because there is a strong correlation between guns kept in private homes and incidences occurring at home - like private disputes involving the husband shooting the wife and maybe the children, and then committing suicide."<ref name=bbc>{{cite web | url=https://www.bbc.com/news/magazine-21379912 | title=Switzerland guns: Living with firearms the Swiss way | work=BBC News Magazine | date=11 February 2013 | accessdate=22 November 2015}}</ref> He has also said that as the Swiss government reduced the size of its Army, gun violence rates in that country have dropped.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/world/2013/01/27/world-gun-rules/1869003/ | title=Around world, gun rules, and results, vary wildly | work=USA Today | date=27 January 2013 | accessdate=22 November 2015 | author=Associated Press}}</ref> In response to those who cite Switzerland as evidence that guns deter violence, Killias has said that in Switzerland, "We have guns at home, but they are kept for peaceful purposes. There is no point taking the gun out of your home in Switzerland because it is illegal to carry a gun in the street. To shoot someone who just looks at you in a funny way - this is not Swiss culture!"<ref name=bbc/>
==Honors and awards== In 2001, Killias received the Sellin-Glueck Award from the [[American Society of Criminology]]. In 2008, he received the G.O.W. Mueller Award for outstanding research in international criminal law from the [[Academy of Criminal Justice Sciences]]. In 2013, he received an honorary doctorate from the [[Panteion University of Athens]].<ref name=honorary/> In 2017, he received the Beccaria Medal in Gold from the Deutsche Kriminologische Gesellschaft.<ref>{{Cite web |url= https://www.unisg.ch/en/wissen/newsroom/aktuell/rssnews/leute/2017/oktober/beccaria-medaille-killias-4oktober2017 |title= University of St.Gallen {{!}} Knowledge {{!}} Martin Killias awarded the Beccaria Medal |website= University of St.Gallen |language=en |access-date= 2017-11-12}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}} {{Authority control}}

Made for [[Bank of Hawaii]] as a promotional giveaway to encourage island children to save their [[Penny|pennies]].]]
'''Menehune''' are a mythological [[Dwarf (mythology)|dwarf]] people in [[Hawaiian religion|Hawaiian tradition]] who live in the deep forests and hidden valleys of the [[Hawaiian Islands]], hidden and far away from human settlements.
The Menehune are described as superb craftspeople. They built temples (''[[heiau]]''), [[Ancient Hawaiian aquaculture|fishponds]], roads, [[canoe]]s, and houses. Some of these structures that Hawaiian folklore attributed to the Menehune still exist. They are said to have lived in [[Hawaii|Hawai{{okina}}i]] before settlers arrived from [[Polynesia]] many centuries ago. Their favorite food is the ''mai{{okina}}a'' ([[banana]]), and they also like fish.
In [[Martha Warren Beckwith]]'s ''Hawaiian Mythology'', there are references to several other forest dwelling races: the ''[[Nawao]]'', who were large-sized wild hunters descended from [[Lua-nu'u|Lua-nu{{okina}}u]], the ''mu'' people, and the ''wa'' people.<ref>Beckwith 1970, pp. 321-323</ref>
Some early scholars theorized that there was a first settlement of Hawai{{okina}}i, by settlers from the [[Marquesas Islands]], and a second, from [[Tahiti]]. The Tahitian settlers oppressed the "commoners", the ''manahune'' in the [[Tahitian language]], who fled to the mountains and were called Menahune. Proponents of this theory point to an 1820 census of [[Kauai|Kaua{{okina}}i]] by [[Kaumualii|Kaumuali{{okina}}i]], the ruling ''[[Alii|ali{{okina}}i aimoku]]'' of the island, which listed 65 people as ''menehune''.<ref>Joesting 1987, pp. 20-22</ref>
Folklorist [[Katharine Luomala]] believes that the legends of the ''Menehune'' are a post-European contact mythology created by adaptation of the term ''manahune'' (which by the time of the colonizing of the Hawaiian Islands by Europeans had acquired a meaning of "lowly people" or "low social status" and not diminutive in stature) to European legends of [[brownie (elf)|brownie]]s.<ref>Luomala 1951</ref> '"It is claimed that "Menehune" are not mentioned in pre-contact mythology, although this is unproven since it was clearly an oral mythology; the legendary "overnight" creation of the Alekoko fishpond, for example, finds its equivalent in the legend<ref>Nordhoff 1874</ref> about the creation of a corresponding structure on [[Oahu|O{{okina}}ahu]], which was supposedly indeed completed in a single day — not by ''menehune'' but, as a show of power, by a local ''[[alii|ali{{okina}}i]]'' who demanded every one of his subjects to appear at the construction site and assist in building.
No physical evidence for the existence of a historical person that fits the description of the Menehune has been discovered.<ref>p. 142, Pukui, Mary Kawena, Elbert, Samuel H., and Mookini, Esther T. Mookini. ''Place Names of Hawaii: Revised & Expanded Edition.'' Honolulu: University of Hawaii Press, 1974.</ref>
==Structures attributed to the Menehune== * [[Menehune Fishpond]]<ref>[[Menehune Fishpond]]</ref>{{Better source|reason=per WP:CIRCULAR|date=October 2015}} wall at [[Niumalu]], Kaua{{okina}}i * [[Kikiaola|Kīkīaola]] ditch at [[Waimea, Kauai County, Hawaii|Waimea]], Kaua{{okina}}i * [[Necker Island (Northwestern Hawaiian Islands)|Necker Island]] structures * ''Pa o ka menehune'', breakwater at [[Kahaluu Bay|Kahalu{{okina}}u Bay]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://sanctuaries.noaa.gov/about/pdfs/kic_brochure.pdf |title=Hoʻihoʻi Kulana Wahi pana - Restoring Sacred Places |publisher=brochure published by Kamehameha Investment Corporation |year=2008 |accessdate=2009-10-20 }}</ref> * [[Ulupo Heiau State Historic Site|Ulupo Heiau]] at Kailua, Oahu [[File:Menehune Statue .jpg|thumb|Menehune statue]]
==Other uses== * In the experimental 1970s ''[[ALOHAnet|Aloha]]'' network developed at the University of Hawaii, the packet controllers were called Menehune, a [[pun]] on the equivalent ''IMP'' ([[Interface Message Processor]]) in the early [[ARPAnet]]. The modern Ethernet was based on the carrier sense multiple access with collision detection (CSMA/CD) methodology pioneered by ALOHAnet. * The Menehune is the school [[mascot]] of [[Waimea High School]] on Kaua'i and [[Makakilo Elementary School]], [[Maunawili Elementary School]], [[Moanalua High School]] and [[Mililani Waena Elementary School]] on [[O'ahu]]. * [[United Airlines]] used the Menehune in brand advertising for their service to Hawaii in the 1970s through the 1980s. The figurines and travel agency displays are now collectors' items.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://advertisingiconmuseum.org/inside/c11/3237033.html |title=United Airlines Menehune |publisher=Advertisingiconmuseum.org |date= |accessdate=2013-09-27}}</ref> * [[Carl Barks]] wrote a story featuring [[Scrooge McDuck]] helped by Menehunes, "[[The Menehune Mystery]]". * The Menehune play a key role in the ''[[Rocket Power]]'' TV movie, ''[[Island of the Menehune (Rocket Power)|Island of the Menehune]]''.
